data.price: Tā sīn mīm.[1]
data.footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.

data.price: These are the verses of the clear Book.
Perhaps you[2] will grieve yourself to death because they do not believe.
data.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [2] O Muhammad.

data.price: If We willed, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven, at which their necks would stay bowed in humility[3].
data.arabic: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., they would be compelled to believe, being humbled.

data.price: No new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate except that they turn away from it.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: They have rejected [the Truth], soon there will come to them the consequences of their ridicule.
data.arabic: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ

data.price: Do they not see the earth, how many fine kinds of plants We grow in it?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them will not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
And [remember] when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people –
data.arabic: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

data.price: the people of Pharaoh; will they not fear [the punishment of] Allah?”
He said, “My Lord, I fear that they may reject me,
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ

data.price: and I will feel distressed and my tongue will not be fluent, so send Aaron along [to help me].
data.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ

data.price: Moreover, they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me[4].”
data.arabic: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ
data.footnotes: [4] For killing a Coptic Egyptian by mistake before becoming a prophet.

data.price: Allah said, “Certainly not! Go, both of you, with Our signs[5]; We are with you, listening.
data.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the miracles of the staff and the shining hand, given to Moses.

data.price: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are the messengers[6] from the Lord of the worlds,
data.arabic: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [6] The singular form in Arabic denotes that they both were sent with a single message.

data.price: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.’”
Pharaoh said, “Did we not bring you up as a child among us, and you stayed with us several years of your life?
data.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ

data.price: Yet you did what you did[7], and you are extremely ungrateful.”
data.arabic: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., striking the Copt in support of a man from your people, who died as a result.

data.price: He said, “I did it when I had no guidance.
data.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: So I fled from you in fear. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.
data.arabic: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: Is this a favor that you remind me with, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?[8]
data.arabic: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., If you had not been cruel to the Israelites, I should not have been brought to your house for upbringing.

data.price: Pharaoh said, “What is ‘the Lord of the worlds’?”
Moses said, “The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if only you had sure faith.”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ

data.price: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear [what he just said]?”
Moses said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”
Pharaoh said, “Your messenger who has been sent to you is truly insane!”
data.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ

data.price: Moses said, “Lord of the east and west and all that is between them, if only you had sense!”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: Pharaoh said, “If you take any god other than me, I will throw you into prison.”
data.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ

data.price: Moses said, “What if I bring you a clear proof?”
Pharaoh said, “Bring it then if you are truthful!”
data.arabic: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: So he threw down his staff, and suddenly it was a real serpent.
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: And he drew out his hand, and it was glowing white to the beholders.
data.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ

data.price: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “This is indeed a learned magician!
data.arabic: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ

data.price: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic. What do you suggest?”
data.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ

data.price: They said, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch heralds to the cities
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ

data.price: to bring you every learned magician.”
So the magicians were assembled at an appointed time on a known day[9].
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., the morning of the festival day. See 20:58-59.

data.price: And it was said to the people, “Will you join the gathering,
so that we may follow the magicians, if they are victorious?”
data.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, “Will there be a reward for us if we are victorious?”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: He said, “Yes, and then you will surely be of those who are close to me.”
data.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ

data.price: Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you wish to throw.”
data.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ

data.price: So they threw their ropes and staffs, and said, “By the glory of Pharaoh, it is we who will be the victorious!”
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ

data.price: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it swallowed up all objects of their illusion.
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ

data.price: So the magicians fell down in prostration.
They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds,
the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

Pharaoh said, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your master who taught you magic, but you will soon come to know. I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all.”
data.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: They said, “No harm; we will surely return to our Lord.
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ

data.price: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers.”
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: We inspired Moses, “Leave with My slaves by night; you will surely be pursued.”
data.arabic: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ

data.price: So Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities[10],
data.footnotes: [10] In order to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.

data.price: saying, “These are but a small band,
and they have enraged us,
but we are all well-prepared.”
Thus did We drive them[11] out of their gardens and springs,
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., Pharaoh and his people.

data.price: and their treasures and splendid dwellings.
So it was, and We made the Children of Israel to inherit them.
They pursued them at sunrise.
When the two groups saw each other, the companions of Moses said, “We are surely overtaken!”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ

data.price: Moses said, “Certainly not! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”
data.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

data.price: Then We inspired Moses, “Strike the sea with your staff,” so it parted, and each part became like a huge mountain.
data.arabic: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: Then We brought the others [i.e., the pursuers] close to that place,
and We saved Moses and all those who were with him.
Then we drowned the others.
Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
Relate to them the story of Abraham,
when he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: They said, “We worship idols and remain devoted to them.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ

data.price: He said, “Do they hear you when you call upon them?
Or can they benefit or harm you?”
They said, “No, but this is what we found our forefathers doing.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: He said, “Do you see what you have been worshiping,
you and your ancestors?
Indeed, they are my enemies, except the Lord of the worlds[12],
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [12] As they worshiped idols in addition to worshiping Allah.

data.price: Who created me, so He guides me;
and it is He Who provides me with food and drink;
and when I am ill He heals me;
and He will cause me to die and then bring me back to life;
and I hope that He will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.”
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: “My Lord, grant me knowledge, and join me with the righteous,
data.arabic: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: and grant me an honorable mention among the later generations[13],
data.arabic: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [13] Muslims invoke Allah’s blessings upon Abraham (ﷺ) along with Muhammad (ﷺ) in their daily prayers.

data.price: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss;
and forgive my father, for he is one of those who have gone astray;
data.arabic: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: and do not disgrace me on the Day when all will be resurrected –
the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ

data.price: except the one who comes to Allah with a sound heart[14].”
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [14] A heart free from disbelief, polytheism, hypocrisy, arrogance, and show-off.

data.price: Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,
and Hellfire will be uncovered to those who went astray,
and they will be told, “Where are those whom you used to worship
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: other than Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?”
data.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ

data.price: Then they will be hurled into Hell one upon another, along with those who led them astray,
and the followers of Iblīs, all together.
There the deviants will say while quarreling with their false deities,
“By Allah, we were clearly misguided,
data.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: when we deemed you equal to the Lord of the worlds.
None led us astray except the wicked.
Now we neither have any intercessors,
nor a close friend.
If only we had a chance to return, we would be among the believers.”
data.arabic: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is surely the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the messengers[15]
data.footnotes: [15] For denying Noah was equal to denying all of the messengers of Allah.

data.price: when their brother Noah said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.
I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.”
They said, “Shall we believe in you when you are followed by the lowest people[16]?”
data.footnotes: [16] For they were mostly the poor and ordinary people, who enjoyed no position in society.

data.price: He said, “What knowledge do I have of what they do?
data.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: Their reckoning is only with my Lord if you realize!
data.arabic: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: I am not going to drive the believers away.
I am only a clear warner.”
They said, “O Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ

data.price: He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.
So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers who are with me.”
data.arabic: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: So We saved him and those who were with him in the fully laden Ark.
data.arabic: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ

data.price: Then We drowned thereafter all the rest.
Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of ‘Ād rejected the messengers
when their brother Hūd said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.
I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Do you build a landmark[17] on every high place for no purpose?
data.footnotes: [17] They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by passersby, as a symbol of their wealth and power.

data.price: And do you construct for yourselves palaces, hoping that you will live forever?
And when you attack [others], do you attack ruthlessly?
So fear Allah, and obey me.
And fear the One Who has provided you with everything you know:
Who provided you with livestock and children,
and with gardens and springs.
I fear for you the punishment of a momentous day.”
data.arabic: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: They said, “It is the same to us whether you admonish us or not.
data.arabic: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ

data.price: This is nothing but the custom of the former people,
and we will never be punished.”
Thus they rejected him, so We destroyed them. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe,
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Thamūd rejected the messengers
when their brother Sālih said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.
I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Will you be left secure in whatever you have here,
in gardens and springs,
and in fields of crops and date palms laden with tender fruit,
carving out houses in the mountains with great skill?
So fear Allah, and obey me.
And do not obey the command of the transgressors,
those who spread corruption in the land and never do what is right.”
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ

data.price: They said, “You are but one of those who are bewitched!
You are but a human like us, so bring a sign if you are one of the truthful.”
data.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: Sālih said, “This is a she-camel[18]; she will have her share of water and you will have yours, each on a specified day.
data.arabic: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
data.footnotes: [18] That was miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allah.

data.price: Do not touch her with harm, or you will be seized by the punishment of a horrible day.”
data.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: But they hamstrung her, then they became regretful,
So the punishment seized them[19]. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [19] They were destroyed by a violent earthquake and a blast after Sālih told them: “You have only three days to enjoy yourselves in your houses”. See 11:65. Allah says: “We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs”. See 54:31.

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of Lot rejected the messengers,
when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.
I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Do you approach males with lust among all people[20],
data.footnotes: [20] i.e., Are there any creatures besides you who commit this abominable act?

data.price: leaving the wives whom your Lord has created for you? You are but a transgressing people.”
data.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ

data.price: They said, “O Lot, If you do not desist, you will surely be expelled.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ

data.price: Lot said, “I am one of those who utterly abhor your practice.
My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequences of] what they do.”
So We saved him and all his family,
except an old woman who was among those who remained behind[21].
data.footnotes: [21] Lot's wife, who betrayed him by not believing and remained a disbeliever; thus, she was among those destroyed.

data.price: Then We destroyed the rest,
and We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. How terrible was the rain of those who were warned!
data.arabic: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
The people of the Forest[22] rejected the messengers.
data.footnotes: [22] i.e., the people of Madyan, to whom Shu‘ayb was sent.

data.price: When Shu‘ayb said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
so fear Allah, and obey me.
I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Give full measure and do not be of those who defraud others,
data.arabic: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ

data.price: and weigh with accurate scales,
and do not defraud people of their goods, nor go about in the land spreading corruption.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ

data.price: And fear the One Who created you and the former peoples[23].”
data.footnotes: [23] i.e., generations of the past.

data.price: They said, “You are truly bewitched!
You are only a human being like us, and we think you are nothing but a liar.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ

data.price: So cause pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if you are of the truthful.”
data.arabic: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: Shu‘ayb said, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”
Thus they rejected him, so they were seized by the punishment of the cloudy day; it was the punishment of a horrible day.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
This is indeed a revelation from the Lord of the worlds,
which the Trustworthy Spirit [Gabriel] has brought down
to your heart [O Prophet] so that you may be one of the warners,
in a clear Arabic language.
And it was indeed [mentioned] in the scriptures of the former peoples.
Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of the Children of Israel recognized it [to be true][24]?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
data.footnotes: [24] e.g., Abdullah ibn Salām, a Jewish scholar, accepted Islam during the lifetime of the Prophet (ﷺ), for he knew that he came with a true message.

data.price: If We had sent it down to any of the non-Arabs,
and he had recited it to them[25]; still, they would not have believed in it.
data.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [25] As a miracle from Allah.

data.price: This is how We made it [i.e., disbelief] enter the hearts of the wicked.
They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment,
data.arabic: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ

data.price: which will come upon them suddenly when they least expect it.
They will then say, “Can we be granted some respite?”
Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?
Tell me [O Prophet] if We give them a life of ease for years,
then there came to them what they were warned of,
what would avail them the life of ease that they were given?
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ

data.price: We never destroyed any town without sending them warners,
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ

data.price: to admonish them, for We are never unjust.
This [Qur’an] is not sent down by the devils[26],
data.footnotes: [26] As the disbelievers claim; rather, it is brought down by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.

data.price: it is not for them to do this, nor is it within their capability,
for they are strictly barred from overhearing it[27].
data.footnotes: [27] So they cannot eavesdrop on heaven. See 72:9.

data.price: So do not call upon any other god besides Allah, lest you become of those who will be punished.
data.arabic: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ

data.price: And warn [starting with] the nearest kinsfolk,
and lower your wing [in kindness] to the believers who follow you.
data.arabic: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: But if they disobey you, say, “I disown what you do.”
data.arabic: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,
Who sees you when you stand up [for prayer],
and your movements among those who prostrate.
Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
Shall I inform you upon who the devils descend?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

data.price: They descend upon every sinful liar,
who whisper hearsay in the ears, but most of them are liars.
As for poets, they are followed by the deviants.
Do you not see that they wander aimlessly in every valley[28],
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ
data.footnotes: [28] Telling lies indiscriminately, praising some, and disparaging others.

data.price: and that they say what they do not do?
Except those who believe, do righteous deeds, remember Allah much and defend themselves[29] after being wronged. The wrongdoers will come to know what end awaits them.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [29] By replying to the satire of hostile poets through poetry.
